original: Lundgren, Gunnar Fritiof, överste, Halmstad, f. 15/8/94 i Jäla, Skarab. 1., av folkskoll. Gerhard Alfred L. o. Ida Sofia Pers-son. G. 30 m. Greta Elisabet Forssman. Barn: Claes Erik Gunnar f. 31, Per Erik Gerhard 32, Nils Erik Gunnar 35 (d. 39), Märta Greta Elisabet 45. — Stud:ex. i Skara 14, off:ex. 16, GCI 21-23, KHS 29-31, aspir. v. gen :staben 31-34. Fänrik v. Västg. reg. 16, löjtn. där 18, v. Älvsb. reg. 27, kapt. där 31, v. genistaben 34, åter v. Älvsb. reg. 37, major v. Södermani. reg. s. å., öv:löjtn. v. Hall. reg. 41, överste i armén 46. Repetitör v. inf:skjutsk. 24, 25, 28 o. 29, komp :off. o. lär. v. inf :underoff :-sk. o. AUS 25-28, gen istabsoif. v. södra arméförd. stab 34-37. Nämndeman i Halmstad. Led. av polisndn i Strängnäs 40-41. av drätselkamm. i Halmstad 46, intend. i Hall. turist-trafikfören. 46. RSO, Arméns skytteM, FMM.
translated: Lundgren, Gunnar Fritiof, Colonel, Halmstad, b. 15/8/94 in Jäla, Skaraborg County, son of elementary school teacher Gerhard Alfred L. and Ida Sofia Persson. Married in 1930 to Greta Elisabet Forssman. Children: Claes Erik Gunnar b. 1931, Per Erik Gerhard b. 1932, Nils Erik Gunnar b. 1935 (d. 1939), Märta Greta Elisabet b. 1945. Completed high school in Skara in 1914, officer training in 1916, General Staff College in 1921-1923, Royal Hungarian Army War College in 1929-1931, served as an aspirant at the General Staff from 1931-1934. Promoted to Ensign in Västergötland Regiment in 1916, Lieutenant in the same regiment in 1918, transferred to Älvsborg Regiment in 1927, Captain in 1931, served in the General Staff in 1934, returned to Älvsborg Regiment in 1937, Major in Södermanland Regiment in the same year, Lieutenant Colonel in Halland Regiment in 1941, Colonel in the Swedish Army in 1946. Instructor at Infantry Shooting School in 1924, 1925, 1928 and 1929, company officer and instructor at infantry non-commissioned officer school and Army Underofficers' School in 1925-1928, Staff Officer in the southern army command from 1934-1937. Member of the jury in Halmstad. Member of the police board in Strängnäs in 1940-1941. Member of the finance committee in Halmstad in 1946, director of tourism in Halland Tourist Traffic Association in 1946. Decorations: Royal Order of the Seraphim, Army Shooting Medal, Fleet Long Service and Good Conduct Medal.

awards.name: Fleet Long Service and Good Conduct Medal
